benchmark_details.name: HowToDIV
benchmark_details.overview: HowToDIV is a large-scale dataset comprising 507 conversations and 6,636 user-expert dialogue turns, involving task assistance across diverse domains such as cooking, mechanics, and planting. It enables the generation of interactive dialogues for procedural tasks without manual data collection.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To present a scalable and cost-efficient dataset for generating dialogues in procedural task assistance, aiding in the training of AI agents.

data.source: Built upon two publicly available instructional video datasets: Narrated Instruction Videos (NIV) and Egocentric Procedural Error (EgoPER).
data.size: 24 hours of video footage, 507 conversations, 6,636 dialogue turns
data.annotation: Automatic generation using large language models, no manual annotation.

methods: Dialogue generation using pre-trained language models
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the overlap between generated outputs and reference texts for dialogue turns.
methodology.interpretation: BLEU scores range from 0 to 1; higher values indicate better match to reference dialogues. The LLM-as-a-Judge score is on a scale from 1 to 5, with higher scores indicating better quality.
methodology.baseline_results: Gemma-3 model scores: BLEU = 0.32, ROUGE-L = 0.270, LLM-as-Judge = 2.87.
methodology.validation: Dataset is split into training (70%), validation (10%), and testing (20%) sets.
